alert.note: Alert for Chickasaw; Floyd; Howard; Mitchell (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 13 at 8:52AM CST until January 14 at 12:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Drifting Snow and Slick Travel Followed by Bitter Cold... .Light snow lingers through the day with gusty winds leading to some drifting across roadways, particularly across open areas of southeast Minnesota and northeast Iowa. Travel conditions improve through the day, but be prepared for slick travel on any snow- covered or untreated roads. Bitterly cold air impacts the region tonight into the start of the new week with wind chill values of 25 to 35 degrees below zero. Limit time outdoors, if possible. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. * WHERE...In Iowa, Mitchell, Howard, Floyd and Chickasaw Counties. In Minnesota, Mower County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 PM CST this evening. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to noon CST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. In Iowa, visit 511ia.org for road conditions. In Minnesota, visit 511mn.org for road conditions.
